family.comment: DAC20 is a stationary decoder with a lot of additional features

label.label: Set Base address for calling routes from a Throttle, add from 1 to 7 to this address to trigger subsequent routes
Enter either Cell number 1-8 for Closed, or 11-18 for Thrown
or use two Elements to enter values Y and X, see DAC20 manual
Set Base address for calling routes from a Throttle, add from 1 to 7 to this address to trigger subsequent routes
Enter either Cell number 1-8 for Closed, or 11-18 for Thrown
or use two Elements to enter values Y and X, see DAC20 manual
Advanced Conditional rules based on the status of the DAC20 inputs, outputs and any devices listed in the External Devices table.
Each output on the DAC20 can be triggered automatically if the conditions occur. Set each Element in the Condition as follows:
DAC20 inputs 1-10 are ACTIVE, Element values are 1-10. If INACTIVE, Element values are 61-70.
DAC20 outputs 1-8 are THROWN, Element values are 11-18. If CLOSED, Element values are 71-78.
DAC20 external devices 1-40 are THROWN or RED, Element values are 21-60. If CLOSED or NOT RED, Element values are 81-120.
If the Output is a Turnout, create rules for THROWN and CLOSED, plus rules which will LOCK the turnout
If the Output is a Light, create two groups of rules for ON, plus rules which will LOCK the light
Turnout 1 Thrown
Or Light 1 (On) group 1
Turnout 1 Closed
Or Light 1 (On) group 2
Turnout 2 Thrown
Or Light 2 (On) group 1
Turnout 2 Closed
Or Light 2 (On) group 2
Lock Output 1 Conditions
Lock Output 2 Conditions

Advanced Conditional rules based on the status of the DAC20 inputs, outputs and any devices listed in the External Devices table.
For each ROUTE defined in the Route Tables, optionally select conditional elements to trigger the ROUTE as follows:
DAC20 inputs 1-10 are ACTIVE, Element values are 1-10. If INACTIVE, Element values are 61-70.
DAC20 outputs 1-8 are THROWN, Element values are 11-18. If CLOSED, Element values are 71-78.
DAC20 external devices 1-40 are THROWN or RED, Element values are 21-60. If CLOSED or NOT RED, Element values are 81-120.
External Devices can be used in Conditional rules. These may be any turnout, signal or sensor, including 'imaginary' ones not represented on the layout
If an External Device is used in more than one Conditional rule it only needs to be defined once in this table
If a Turnout, calculate X and Y as follows: The address, 1 to 2048 is made up as Y*256 + X . X takes values 0-255, Y values 0-8
If a Signal, add 10 to the value calculated for Y, thus for an address 1 to 2048 is made up as ( Y*256 - 10 ) + X. X takes values 0-255, Y values 10-18
If a Sensor, the Board number (1-255) is written into X, the sensor number (1-16) has 100 added to it and written into Y (thus Y = 101-116)
